overview:
Kate Hiscox is also the founder of TinyMassive (http://moneycentral.msn.com/companyreport?symbol=CA:TNY). Kate is a serial entrepreneur and counts TinyMassive Technologies and Bablingo.com amongst her projects. Kate eats, breathes and sleeps company strategy and is often found wreaking havoc inside carefully produced financial models.

Kate claims to know a bit about e-commerce and online marketing. In 2003 she founded Lunawarehouse.com, the online consumer lighting web site. The site was acquired in May 2007 and Kate started TinyMassive.com which became a publicly traded company on the CNSX in December 2009. Kate went on to start Spudaroo.com, the online crowd sourcing platform for business and legal content which was acquired in October, 2010.

Currently, Kate is working on Bablingo.com. Bablingo is busy creating innovation that improves the distribution and publication of news and events through semantic search and relevancy.

Kate attended a very small school in the UK that few people have heard of but is very grateful to her friends that she wasnâ€™t identified as the one who threw that snowball.

Specialties Online retail, semantic and sentiment analysis, algorithmic processes, marketing and business development.
